content.raw:
I think things should be working right now if one does a fresh install. To fix a broken system, make sure you are using the latest Ubuntu packages:

~~~
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get upgrade
~~~

Then make sure you have the latest [valkyrie_controller.tar.gz](https://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com/srcsim/valkyrie_controller.tar.gz) tarball extracted in your home folder.

If it's still not working, you may also need to clear the `~/.gradle` folder and some of the files in `/opt/ros/indigo/share/ihmc_ros_java_adapter/`. I can't remember the exact list of files, so in the past I have uninstalled the `ros-indigo-ihmc-ros-java-adapter` package, then deleted the remaining files, then reinstalled `srcsim`, and repeat the `chown` step from the installation instructions.

If that doesn't fix it, then please post the full console output to https://gist.github.com or https://bitbucket.org/snippets/new and provide a link.

Thanks, and sorry for the trouble.
content.html:
I think things should be working right now if one does a fresh install. To fix a broken system, make sure you are using the latest Ubuntu packages:

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get upgrade

Then make sure you have the latest valkyrie_controller.tar.gz tarball extracted in your home folder.

If it's still not working, you may also need to clear the ~/.gradle folder and some of the files in /opt/ros/indigo/share/ihmc_ros_java_adapter/. I can't remember the exact list of files, so in the past I have uninstalled the ros-indigo-ihmc-ros-java-adapter package, then deleted the remaining files, then reinstalled srcsim, and repeat the chown step from the installation instructions.

If that doesn't fix it, then please post the full console output to https://gist.github.com or https://bitbucket.org/snippets/new and provide a link.

Thanks, and sorry for the trouble.
